title: What is Topics?
content: Topics is a static site generator that creates searchable FAQ-style pages from JSON, EDN, or YAML data.

title: How do I install Topics?
content:
Topics requires Babashka. Once installed, simply run:

bb topics.clj your-data.json

title: What input formats are supported?
content:
Topics supports three input formats:

  • JSON - JavaScript Object Notation
  • EDN - Extensible Data Notation (Clojure)
  • YAML - YAML Ain't Markup Language

The format is auto-detected from the file extension, or you can specify it with -f.

title: How do I customize the site title?
content:
Use the -T or --title option:

bb topics.clj -T "My FAQ" data.json

title: Can I add custom CSS?
content:
Yes! Use the -C option to include a custom CSS file:

bb topics.clj -C custom.css data.json

Your styles will override the default Pico CSS framework styles.

title: How do I use a configuration file?
content:
Create an EDN file with your settings:

{:title "My Site"
 :tagline "Questions answered"
 :lang "fr"}

Then pass it with -c:

bb topics.clj -c config.edn data.json

title: Can I use Topics with org-parse?
content:
Yes! Topics can directly consume an org-parse AST. Simply pass the JSON output from org-parse:

org-parse notes.org -f json > ast.json
bb topics.clj -l 2 ast.json

The -l option controls the heading level for flattening sections.

title: How does search work?
content:
Topics includes a client-side search that:

  • Searches both titles and content
  • Normalizes accents (e.g., "caf√©" matches "cafe")
  • Updates the URL for shareable search links
  • Works entirely offline after page load

title: What languages are supported?
content:
Currently Topics supports English (en) and French (fr) for UI strings. Set the language with:

bb topics.clj -g fr data.json
